notes.left: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submission area. For example, PACA-CA is a Program ID.
notes.right: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Program Services area. For example, TEST-CA is a Program ID.

description.left: Indicate the donor's menopause status at the time of primary diagnosis. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 2434914)
description.right: Indicate the donor's menopause status at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2434914)

cancer_type_prior_malignancy.description: The code to represent the cancer type of a prior malignancy using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en) classification.
cancer_type_prior_malignancy.name: cancer_type_prior_malignancy

age_at_prior_malignancy.description: If donor has history of prior malignancy, indicate age at previous diagnosis, in years.
age_at_prior_malignancy.name: age_at_prior_malignancy

laterality_of_prior_malignancy.description: If donor has history of prior malignancy, indicate laterality of previous diagnosis.
laterality_of_prior_malignancy.name: laterality_of_prior_malignancy

description.left: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this specimen aquisition was related to.
description.right: Indicate the primary diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this specimen acquisition was related to.

description.left: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.
description.right: Specify the tumour stage, based on pathological_tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

notes.left: This field depends on the selected pathological staging system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
notes.right:
This field depends on the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

notes.left: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.
notes.right: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

description.left: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Please refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.
description.right: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

description.left: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.
description.right: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

notes.left: This field depends on the selected tumour grading system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
notes.right:
This field depends on the selected tumour_grading_system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Grading Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-grading-classifications

notes.left: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.
This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

reference_pathology_confirmed.name: reference_pathology_confirmed
reference_pathology_confirmed.description: Indicate whether the pathological diagnosis was confirmed by a (central) reference pathologist.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

central_pathology_confirmed.name: central_pathology_confirmed
central_pathology_confirmed.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

description.left: Age that the donor was first diagnosed with cancer, in years.
description.right: Age that the donor was first diagnosed with cancer, in years. This should be based on the earliest diagnosis of cancer.

description.left: The number of regional lymph nodes reported as being positive for tumour metastases. (Reference: NCI CDE ID: 6113694)
description.right: The number of regional lymph nodes reported as being positive for tumour metastases. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 6113694)

notes.right: This field is only required if 'lymph_nodes_examined_status' is 'Yes'.

description.left: The total number of lymph nodes tested for the presence of cancer. (Reference: NCI CDE ID: 3)
description.right: The total number of lymph nodes tested for the presence of cancer. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 3)

description.left: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).
description.right: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting clinical_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

notes.right:
This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

notes.left: To include multiple values, separate values with a comma ',' within your file.
notes.right: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

description.left: Indicate the donor's performance status grade at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference source: ECOG performance score grades from https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).
description.right: Indicate the donor's performance status grade at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference: ECOG performance score grades from https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).

notes.left:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction 
 Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work) 
 Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair
notes.right:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work).
Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

cancer_type_additional_information.name: cancer_type_additional_information
cancer_type_additional_information.description: Additional details related to the cancer type that are not covered by the ICD-10 code provided in the cancer_type field.

lymph_nodes_examined_status.name: lymph_nodes_examined_status
lymph_nodes_examined_status.description: Indicate if lymph nodes were examined for metastases.

codeList: No lymph nodes found in resected specimen

stage_suffix.name: stage_suffix
stage_suffix.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

notes.left: Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treament details may be required to be submitted.  Depending on the treatment_type selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.
notes.right:
Depending on the treatment_type(s) selected, additional treatment details may be required to be submitted. For example, if treatment_type includes 'Chemotherapy', the supplemental Chemotherapy treatment type file is required.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

description.left: Indicate if the treamtment was the primary treatment following the initial diagnosis.
description.right: Indicate if the treatment was the primary treatment following the initial diagnosis.

description.left: The interval between primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.
description.right: The interval between the primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.

notes.left: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.
notes.right: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

line_of_treatment.name: line_of_treatment
line_of_treatment.description: Indicate the line of treatment if it is not the primary treatment.

days_per_cycle.name: days_per_cycle
days_per_cycle.description: Indicate the number of days in a treatment cycle.

number_of_cycles.name: number_of_cycles
number_of_cycles.description: Indicate the number of treatment cycles.

treatment_intent.name: treatment_intent
treatment_intent.description: Indicate the intended disease outcome for which the treatment is given. (Reference: NCIt C124307)

treatment_setting.name: treatment_setting
treatment_setting.description: Indicate the treatment setting, which describes the treatment's purpose in relation to the primary treatment. (Reference: NCIt C124308)

response_to_treatment.name: response_to_treatment
response_to_treatment.description: The donor's response to the applied treatment regimen. (Source: RECIST)

outcome_of_treatment.name: outcome_of_treatment
outcome_of_treatment.description: Indicate the donor's outcome of the prescribed treatment.

codeList: Treatment incomplete due to technical or organizational problems
Treatment stopped due to lack of efficacy (disease progression)
Treatment stopped due to acute toxicity

toxicity_type.name: toxicity_type
toxicity_type.description: If the treatment was terminated early due to acute toxicity, indicate whether it was due to hemotological toxicity or non-hemotological toxicity.

hemotological_toxicity.name: hemotological_toxicity
hemotological_toxicity.description: Indicate the hemotological toxicities which caused early termination of the treatment. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

adverse_events.name: adverse_events
adverse_events.description: Report any treatment related adverse events. (Codelist reference: NCI-CTCAE (v5.0))

codeList: Blood and lymphatic system disorders - Other, specify
Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify
Ear and labyrinth disorders - Other, specify
General disorders and administration site conditions - Other, specify
Injury, poisoning and procedural complications - Other, specify
Joint range of motion decreased cervical spine
Joint range of motion decreased lumbar spine
Metabolism and nutrition disorders - Other, specify
Musculoskeletal and connective tissue disorder - Other, specify
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps) - Other, specify
Pregnancy, puerperium and perinatal conditions - Other, specify
Renal and urinary disorders - Other, specify
Reproductive system and breast disorders - Other, specify
Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders - Other, specify
Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders - Other, specify
Surgical and medical procedures - Other, specify

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

clinical_trials_database.name: clinical_trials_database
clinical_trials_database.description: If the donor is a participant in a clinical trial, indicate the clinical trial database where the clinical trial is registered.

clinical_trial_number.name: clinical_trial_number
clinical_trial_number.description: Based on the clinical_trial_database, indicate the unique NCT or EudraCT clinical trial identifier of which the donor is a participant.

age_at_consent_for_treatment.name: age_at_consent_for_treatment
age_at_consent_for_treatment.description: Indicate the age of donor when consent was given for treatment.

therapeutic_intent.name: therapeutic_intent
therapeutic_intent.description: The therapeutic intent, the reason behind the choice of a therapy, of the treatment.

response_to_therapy.name: response_to_therapy
response_to_therapy.description: The donors's response to the applied treatment regimen. (Source: RECIST)

notes.left: This field uses a controlled vocabulary gathered from the RxNorm database of drug names provided by the NIH (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm).
notes.right:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

notes.left: This field uses a controlled vocabulary gathered from the RxNorm database of drug names provided by the NIH (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm).
notes.right:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

description.right: Indicate the total actual drug dose in the same units specified in chemotherapy_dosage_units.

description.left: Indicate the number of total fractions delivered as part of treatment.
description.right: Indicate the total number of fractions delivered as part of treatment.

radiation_therapy_type.name: radiation_therapy_type
radiation_therapy_type.description: Indicate type of radiation therapy administered.

application_form.name: application_form
application_form.description: Indicate type of radiation therapy administered.

description.left: Unique identifier for a follow-up event in a donors clincal record, assigned by the data provider.
description.right: Unique identifier for a follow-up event in a donor's clinical record, assigned by the data provider.

notes.left: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.
notes.right: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

description.left: Indicate the donor's disease status at time of follow-up.
description.right: Indicate the donor's disease status at time of follow-up. (Reference: RECIST)

notes.left: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.
notes.right: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

description.left: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
description.right: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.

notes.left: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a progression or relapse value.
notes.right: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

description.left: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression disease status. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 6161031)
description.right: Indicate the method(s) used to confirm the donor's progression or relapse or recurrence disease status. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 6161031)

notes.left: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse
notes.right:
This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.
To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

description.left: Indicate the anatomic site where disease progression or recurrence occurred. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 4742851)
description.right: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where disease progression, relapse or recurrence occurred, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

notes.left: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.
notes.right: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

notes.left: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.
notes.right: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

description.left: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.
description.right: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression.

notes.right:
This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

description.left: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.
description.right: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

notes.left: This field is required only if the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.
notes.right:
This field is dependent on the selected posttherapy_tumour_staging_system.
Please refer to the documentation for Tumour Staging Classifications: http://docs.icgc-argo.org/docs/submission/dictionary-overview#tumour-staging-classifications

program_id.name: program_id
program_id.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

submitter_donor_id.name: submitter_donor_id
submitter_donor_id.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

submitter_treatment_id.name: submitter_treatment_id
submitter_treatment_id.description: Unique identifier of the treatment, assigned by the data provider.

immunotherapy_type.name: immunotherapy_type
immunotherapy_type.description: Indicate the type of immunotherapy administered to patient.

codeList: Monoclonal antibodies other than immune checkpoint inhibitors

drug_rxnormcui.name: drug_rxnormcui
drug_rxnormcui.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

drug_name.name: drug_name
drug_name.description: Name of agent or drug administered to patient as part of the treatment regimen.

This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin or https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/search?searchBy=String&searchTerm=leucovorin

program_id.name: program_id
program_id.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

submitter_donor_id.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
submitter_donor_id.name: submitter_donor_id

family_relative_id.description: Unique identifier of the relative, assigned by the data provider.
family_relative_id.name: family_relative_id

meta.notes: This field is required to ensure that family members are identified in unique records.  Ids can be as simple as an incremented numeral to ensure uniqueness.

relative_with_cancer_history.description: Indicate if patient has any genetic relatives with a history of cancer. (Reference: NCIt C159104, caDSR CDE ID 6161023)
relative_with_cancer_history.name: relative_with_cancer_history

relationship_type.description: Indicate genetic relationship of the relative to patient. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2179937)
relationship_type.name: relationship_type

gender_of_relative.description: The self-reported gender of related individual.
gender_of_relative.name: gender_of_relative

age_of_relative_at_diagnosis.description: The age (in years) when the patient's relative was first diagnosed. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 5300571)
age_of_relative_at_diagnosis.name: age_of_relative_at_diagnosis

cancer_type_code_of_relative.name: cancer_type_code_of_relative
cancer_type_code_of_relative.description: The code to describe the malignant diagnosis of the patient's relative with a history of cancer using the WHO ICD-10 code (https://icd.who.int/browse10/2019/en) classification.

relative_vital_status.description: Relative's last known state of living or deceased.
relative_vital_status.name: relative_vital_status

cause_of_death_of_relative.description: Indicate the cause of the death of the relative.
cause_of_death_of_relative.name: cause_of_death_of_relative

relative_survival_time.description: Indicate how long, in days, the relative survived from the time they were diagnosed with cancer.
relative_survival_time.name: relative_survival_time
